Dear Rhonda Ann Westphal:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Discharge plan
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4166
Section (1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of the
Description following information shall be documented in the case record
within 14 days after discharge:
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations,
including medical and dental follow up that is needed, have been
reviewed with the resident and with the parent and with the
responsible case manager.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was released to another agency with a potential medical
condition not reported to transportation.
Investigation
On 6/26/24, I interviewed Complainant 1 and Complainant 2.
Both reported they received Youth A for placement from Macomb
County Juvenile Center. Both reported they were not given
medical information pertaining to Youth A needing a follow up TB
testing.
Complainant 2 reported Youth A was initially placed in their
facility. Youth A’s judge ordered him to go to a secure placement
for a two-week time frame. Complainant 2 reported Youth A was
not discharged from their facility, only placed on hold. After the
two-week court ordered time frame, Complainant 2 reported they
picked up Youth A on 6/17/24 from Macomb County Juvenile
Center. Later in the day, they received a phone call from the
Macomb County agency reporting Youth A will need to have a TB
X-Ray completed at the hospital. Complainant 2 reported their
staff had potentially been exposed to TB due to Youth A riding in
the vehicle with them. Complainant 2 reported no one provided
their staff with verbal or written documentation that stated Youth A
may be positive for TB.
Administrator 1 reported Youth A was placed with them on
6/3/24 and was discharged on 6/17/24. Administrator 1 reported
Youth A was picked up on 6/17/24 and discharge paperwork was
completed on 6/17/24. Administrator 1 reported they complete TB
tests for all new intakes and if there is a positive result, they are
sent for X-rays. There was a delay in sending him to the hospital,
but Administrator 1 was unsure of what that delay was.
2

Administrator 1 reported she did not feel that there was a rule that
was broken.
Nurse 1 reported Youth A had a TB test on 6/12/24 and the
results were read on 6/15/24. Youth A tested positive for TB, so a
chest X-Ray was ordered for 6/17/24. Nurse 1 reported Youth A
was picked up from placement before his X-ray. Nurse 1 reported
she contacted the agency that picked up Youth A and told them
they would need to take him to the appointment. Nurse 1 reported
Youth A was released at 12:20pm and she made the phone call at
1:00-1:15pm.
Documents Reviewed:
• TB Record: Dated 6/12/24 TB was planted, 6/15/24 TB
read as positive, 6/17/24 date for chest X-ray.
• Discharge Release Summary: The discharge was
completed on 6/17/24.
o Under the heading “summary of services provided
including medical and dental”, the document
reported, “routine medical services, dental services.”
o Under the assessment of residents needs that
remain to be met: “N/A”
• Resident Medical Assessment dated 6/15/24: “Medical
isolation X 3 days and/or until cleared by medical.”
Analysis The agency is found to be non-compliant.
• Complainant 1 and Complainant 2 reported they did not
receive information pertaining to Youth A’s medical
concerns when they picked him up from the facility.
• The Discharge Summary completed by Macomb County
Juvenile Center, does not indicate that this information was
passed on. The form is intended to recap the conversation
that was had between the placement and the receiving
parties. In this case, there were no medical concerns noted
or discussed.
• Nurse 1 did contact the new placement within one hour of
discharge, with the important medical details that were not
passed on.
Conclusion Violation Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
